segment.source: Deploying a Driver to a Test Computer
segment.target: Deploying a Driver to a Test Computer

segment.source: Taking advantage of the Visual Studio development environment, the WDK provides a test feature that enables you to build, deploy, and debug a driver on a test computer.
segment.target: Taking advantage of the Visual Studio development environment, the WDK provides a test feature that enables you to build, deploy, and debug a driver on a test computer.

segment.source: To successfully deploy a driver to a test system using the WDK, you must first set up and configure a test computer.
segment.target: To successfully deploy a driver to a test system using the WDK, you must first set up and configure a test computer.

segment.source: You can set up and configure multiple computers if you want to test your driver under different testing scenarios.
segment.target: You can set up and configure multiple computers if you want to test your driver under different testing scenarios.

segment.source: Setting up the test computer
segment.target: Setting up the test computer

segment.source: Follow the instructions for Provision a computer for driver deployment and testing (WDK 10).
segment.target: Follow the instructions for Provision a computer for driver deployment and testing (WDK 10).

segment.source: Note If you run into difficulties setting up the test computer, see Troubleshooting Configuration of Driver Deployment, Testing and Debugging.
segment.target: Note If you run into difficulties setting up the test computer, see Troubleshooting Configuration of Driver Deployment, Testing and Debugging.

segment.source: Setting deployment properties for your driver solution
segment.target: Setting deployment properties for your driver solution

segment.source: From the property pages for your driver package, you have additional control over how you want your driver deployed for testing.
segment.target: From the property pages for your driver package, you have additional control over how you want your driver deployed for testing.

segment.source: You can choose to deploy the driver automatically whenever you build the driver solution in each configuration.
segment.target: You can choose to deploy the driver automatically whenever you build the driver solution in each configuration.

segment.source: Open the property pages for your driver package.
segment.target: Open the property pages for your driver package.

segment.source: Right-click the driver package project in Solution Explorer and select Properties.
segment.target: Right-click the driver package project in Solution Explorer and select Properties.

segment.source: In the property pages for the driver package, click Configuration Properties, click Driver Install, and then click Deployment.
segment.target: In the property pages for the driver package, click Configuration Properties, click Driver Install, and then click Deployment.

segment.source: Select the Enable deployment option.
segment.target: Select the Enable deployment option.

segment.source: When this option is selected, you must select a test computer that you have configured, or select the name of a computer that you want to configure for testing.
segment.target: When this option is selected, you must select a test computer that you have configured, or select the name of a computer that you want to configure for testing.

segment.source: See Provision a computer for driver deployment and testing (WDK 10).
segment.target: See Provision a computer for driver deployment and testing (WDK 10).

segment.source: When you enable deployment for your driver package project, the driver is automatically deployed to the test computer you have selected when you build your solution.
segment.target: When you enable deployment for your driver package project, the driver is automatically deployed to the test computer you have selected when you build your solution.

segment.source: You can use the Deployment property page to configure options for driver installation and deployment.
segment.target: You can use the Deployment property page to configure options for driver installation and deployment.

segment.source: See Deployment Properties for Driver Package Projects.
segment.target: See Deployment Properties for Driver Package Projects.

segment.source: When you enable deployment on a test computer, you can also automatically enable and configure Driver Verifier, KMDF Verifier, or UMDF Verifier on the test computer to enhance the effectiveness of testing.
segment.target: When you enable deployment on a test computer, you can also automatically enable and configure Driver Verifier, KMDF Verifier, or UMDF Verifier on the test computer to enhance the effectiveness of testing.

segment.source: To set these options for the driver package project, click Configuration Properties, click Driver Install, and then click the following property pages.
segment.target: To set these options for the driver package project, click Configuration Properties, click Driver Install, and then click the following property pages.

segment.source: Driver Verifier Properties for Driver Package Projects
segment.target: Driver Verifier Properties for Driver Package Projects

segment.source: KMDF Verifier Properties for Driver Package Projects
segment.target: KMDF Verifier Properties for Driver Package Projects

segment.source: UMDF Verifier Properties for Driver Package Projects
segment.target: UMDF Verifier Properties for Driver Package Projects

segment.source: Building a driver and deploying the driver to test computer
segment.target: Building a driver and deploying the driver to test computer

segment.source: Before you deploy your driver, make sure that you can build your driver solution.
segment.target: Before you deploy your driver, make sure that you can build your driver solution.

segment.source: A driver solution must include the driver and driver package so that the driver can be installed on the test computer.
segment.target: A driver solution must include the driver and driver package so that the driver can be installed on the test computer.

segment.source: For more information, see Creating a Driver Package and Building a Driver.
segment.target: For more information, see Creating a Driver Package and Building a Driver.

segment.source: Before you deploy the driver to the test computer, you also need to sign the driver package.
segment.target: Before you deploy the driver to the test computer, you also need to sign the driver package.

segment.source: See Signing a Driver During Development and Testing.
segment.target: See Signing a Driver During Development and Testing.

segment.source: Select the test computer that you have configured.
segment.target: Select the test computer that you have configured.

segment.source: To deploy the driver, click Build Solution or Deploy Solution from the Build menu, or press F5 to build, deploy, and start debugging.
segment.target: To deploy the driver, click Build Solution or Deploy Solution from the Build menu, or press F5 to build, deploy, and start debugging.

segment.source: When you deploy a driver, the driver files are copied to the %Systemdrive%\\drivertest\\drivers folder on the test computer.
segment.target: When you deploy a driver, the driver files are copied to the %Systemdrive%\\drivertest\\drivers folder on the test computer.

segment.source: If something goes wrong during deployment, you can check to see if the files are copied to the test computer.
segment.target: If something goes wrong during deployment, you can check to see if the files are copied to the test computer.

segment.source: Verify that the .inf, .cat, test cert, and .sys files, and any other necessary files, are present %systemdrive%\\drivertest\\drivers folder.
segment.target: Verify that the .inf, .cat, test cert, and .sys files, and any other necessary files, are present %systemdrive%\\drivertest\\drivers folder.

segment.source: Troubleshooting driver deployment
segment.target: Troubleshooting driver deployment

segment.source: Here are some tips for troubleshooting driver deployment to a test computer when you use Visual Studio and the WDK.
segment.target: Here are some tips for troubleshooting driver deployment to a test computer when you use Visual Studio and the WDK.

segment.source: Deployment fails due to Error code: 2
segment.target: Deployment fails due to Error code: 2

segment.source: Add the following registry key:
segment.target: Add the following registry key:

segment.source: HKLM\Software\Microsoft\DriverTest\Service
segment.target: HKLM\Software\Microsoft\DriverTest\Service

segment.source: Under this key, create a DWORD value DebugSession, and set it to 0.
segment.target: Under this key, create a DWORD value DebugSession, and set it to 0.

segment.source: You only need to set this value once, and it persists for future deployments.
segment.target: You only need to set this value once, and it persists for future deployments.

source.pc: Can't find the deployment properties for the driver project

target.pc: Can't find the deployment properties for the driver project

segment.source: The deployment properties are only available if you have a driver package.
segment.target: The deployment properties are only available if you have a driver package.

segment.source: If your driver solution does not have a driver package project, you need to add one.
segment.target: If your driver solution does not have a driver package project, you need to add one.

segment.source: The driver package contains components, such as the INF file that are needed for installation.
segment.target: The driver package contains components, such as the INF file that are needed for installation.

segment.source: For more information, see Driver Packages and Creating a Driver Package.
segment.target: For more information, see Driver Packages and Creating a Driver Package.

segment.source: Afer you have added the driver package, you can right-click the driver package project in Solution Explorer and select Properties.
segment.target: Afer you have added the driver package, you can right-click the driver package project in Solution Explorer and select Properties.

segment.source: In the property pages for the driver package, click Configuration Properties, click Driver Install, and then click Deployment.
segment.target: In the property pages for the driver package, click Configuration Properties, click Driver Install, and then click Deployment.

source.pc: Problems selecting, configuring or locating the target computer

target.pc: Problems selecting, configuring or locating the target computer

segment.source: For instruction on how to set up the target computer, using Windows Driver Kit (WDK) 8.1 and Windows Driver Kit (WDK) 8, see Provision a computer for driver deployment and testing (WDK 10).
segment.target: For instruction on how to set up the target computer, using Windows Driver Kit (WDK) 8.1 and Windows Driver Kit (WDK) 8, see Provision a computer for driver deployment and testing (WDK 10).

segment.source: If you have problems with provisioning the target computer, see Troubleshooting Configuration of Driver Deployment, Testing and Debugging.
segment.target: If you have problems with provisioning the target computer, see Troubleshooting Configuration of Driver Deployment, Testing and Debugging.

segment.source: If the target computer is running an N or KN version of Windows, you must install the Media Feature Pack for N and KN versions of Windows.
segment.target: If the target computer is running an N or KN version of Windows, you must install the Media Feature Pack for N and KN versions of Windows.

segment.source: See Provision a computer for driver deployment and testing (WDK 10) for more information.
segment.target: See Provision a computer for driver deployment and testing (WDK 10) for more information.

source.pc: Problems installing the driver on 64-bit version of Windows

target.pc: Problems installing the driver on 64-bit version of Windows

segment.source: Starting with Windows Vista, all 64-bit versions of Windows require driver code to have a digital signature for the driver to load.
segment.target: Starting with Windows Vista, all 64-bit versions of Windows require driver code to have a digital signature for the driver to load.

segment.source: See Signing a Driver and Signing a Driver During Development and Testing.
segment.target: See Signing a Driver and Signing a Driver During Development and Testing.

segment.source: The WDK can deploy and install a driver package on a test computer, but only if the driver has all the necessary components for installation, such as an INF file.
segment.target: The WDK can deploy and install a driver package on a test computer, but only if the driver has all the necessary components for installation, such as an INF file.

segment.source: See Driver Packages more information.
segment.target: See Driver Packages more information.

segment.source: Make sure you can install the driver outside of Visual Studio and the WDK.
segment.target: Make sure you can install the driver outside of Visual Studio and the WDK.

segment.source: For example, use the Device Console utility, Devcon to test whether you can install the driver.
segment.target: For example, use the Device Console utility, Devcon to test whether you can install the driver.

segment.source: Make sure the device (if you have one) is connected to the target computer.
segment.target: Make sure the device (if you have one) is connected to the target computer.

segment.source: For more information, see Device and Driver Installation and Creating a Driver Package.
segment.target: For more information, see Device and Driver Installation and Creating a Driver Package.
